pop_afr_amer_alone.long_name: The Black population. Based on American Community Survey ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
pop_afr_amer_alone.short_description: The Black population. Based on American Community Survey ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
pop_afr_amer_alone.long_description: The Black population.. 5-year ACS estimates in provided census geolevels. For non-census geolevels (such as zip codes), spatial overlaps are calculated between census block groups  . Redistribution to non-census geolevels was performed using the redistribute R package.

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table B01001, via the API

pop_afr_amer_alone_parcels.long_name: The Black population. Based on American Community Survey ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
pop_afr_amer_alone_parcels.short_description: The Black population. Based on American Community Survey ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
pop_afr_amer_alone_parcels.long_description: The Black population.. 5-year ACS estimates in provided census geolevels. For non-census geolevels (such as zip codes), spatial overlaps are calculated between census block groups and parcels, then the value of each block group is divided across all living units within each intersecting parcel. Once parcel-level values are assigned, spatial overlaps are calculated between parcels and target regions such that parcel values can be aggregated to each intersecting target region based on proportion of overlap.. Redistribution to non-census geolevels was performed using the redistribute R package.

perc_AAPI_direct.short_description: The Asian American/Pacific Islander population percent. Based on American Community Survey ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
perc_AAPI_direct.long_description: The Asian American/Pacific Islander population percent.. 5-year ACS estimates in provided census geolevels. For non-census geolevels (such as zip codes), spatial overlaps are calculated between census block groups and target regions, then the value of each block group is aggregated/disaggregated to any intersecting target region based on proportion of overlap.. Redistribution to non-census geolevels was performed using the redistribute R package.
perc_AAPI_direct.statement: The Asian American/Pacific Islander population percent is {value} in {region_name}.

sources.name: American Community Survey

perc_wht_alone.short_description: The White population percent. Based on American Community Survey ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
perc_wht_alone.long_description: The White population percent.. 5-year ACS estimates in provided census geolevels. For non-census geolevels (such as zip codes), spatial overlaps are calculated between census block groups  . Redistribution to non-census geolevels was performed using the redistribute R package.
perc_wht_alone.statement: The White population percent is {value} in {region_name}.

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table B01001, via the API

perc_wht_alone_parcels.short_name: The White population percentage using parcels-method
perc_wht_alone_parcels.long_name: The White population percent. Based on American Community Survey ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
perc_wht_alone_parcels.short_description: The White population percent. Based on American Community Survey ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
perc_wht_alone_parcels.long_description: The White population percent.. 5-year ACS estimates in provided census geolevels. For non-census geolevels (such as zip codes), spatial overlaps are calculated between census block groups and parcels, then the value of each block group is divided across all living units within each intersecting parcel. Once parcel-level values are assigned, spatial overlaps are calculated between parcels and target regions such that parcel values can be aggregated to each intersecting target region based on proportion of overlap.. Redistribution to non-census geolevels was performed using the redistribute R package.
perc_wht_alone_parcels.statement: The White population percent is {value} in {region_name}.
